00002 Prototype plotter for plottables based on matplotlib
00003 """

00005 import wx
00006 import matplotlib
00007 from matplotlib.backends.backend_wxagg import FigureCanvasWxAgg as FigureCanvas
00008 from matplotlib.figure import Figure
00009 
00010 import matplotlib.numerix as nx
00011 matplotlib.use("WX")
00012 from PlotItemRegistry import PlotItemRegistry
00013 
00014 def show_tree(obj,d=0):
00015     """Handy function for displaying a tree of graph objects"""
00016     print "%s%s" % ("-"*d,obj.__class__.__name__)
00017     if 'get_children' in dir(obj):
00018         for a in obj.get_children(): show_tree(a,d+1)
00019      
00020 class Plotter(wx.Panel):
00021     """Plotter for matplotlib wrapped in a wx panel
00022 
00023     All plotter rendering will consist of the following steps:
00024 
00025        plot.clear()
00026        plot.properties()
00027        plot.points()/plot.curve()/...
00028        plot.render()
00029     """
00030     
00031     def __init__(self,parent,size=None):
00032         """
00033         Define the plotting panel for the graph.
00034         """
00035         wx.Panel.__init__(self, parent=parent, id=-1)
00036         self.parentparent=parent
00037         self.plotItemsplotItems=parent.plotItems
00038 
00039         # Add the plot widget
00040         self._add_plot_widget_add_plot_widget()
00041 
00042         # Define some constants
00043         self.colorlistcolorlist = ['b','g','r','c','m','y']
00044         self.symbollistsymbollist = ['o','x','^','v','<','>','+','s','d','D','h','H','p']
00045         
00046     def addLine(self,x,y):
00047         # TODO: eventually will specify which figure and axes we want to add to
00048         line, = self.axesaxes.plot(x,y)
00049         
00050         PlotItemRegistry.lines=PlotItemRegistry.lines+1
00051         #self.plotItems.append(['line',line])   
00052         self.plotItemsplotItems['line'+str(PlotItemRegistry.lines)]=line  
00053         # this method should be called anytime a new object is loaded into the plot
00054         self.parentparent.plotBrowser.updateList()  
00055 
00056     def _add_plot_widget(self):
00057         """
00058         Add the plotting widget to the panel
00059         """
00060         # for now make it interactive, although in a real gui one will want to toggle this with a button
00061         matplotlib.interactive(True)
00062         # Put a figure on the panel, add some axes and put it on a canvas
00063         self.figurefigure = Figure()
00064         self.axesaxes   = self.figurefigure.add_subplot(111)
00065         self.canvascanvas = FigureCanvas(self,-1,self.figurefigure)
00066         #self.lines = None
00067         #self.plotItems.append(['figure',self.figure])
00068         #self.plotItems.append(['axes',self.axes])
00069         #self.plotItems['canvas']=self.canvas
00070         self.plotItemsplotItems['figure']=self.figurefigure
00071         self.plotItemsplotItems['axes']=self.axesaxes
00072 
00073         # On Windows, default frame size behaviour is incorrect
00074         # you don't need this under Linux
00075         if False:
00076             tw, th = self.toolbar.GetSizeTuple()
00077             fw, fh = self.canvascanvas.GetSizeTuple()
00078             self.toolbar.SetSize(wx.Size(fw, th))
00079 
00080         # Layout the window
00081         sizer = wx.BoxSizer(wx.VERTICAL)
00082         sizer.Add(self.canvascanvas, 1, wx.LEFT|wx.TOP|wx.GROW)
00083         self.SetSizer(sizer)  
00084 
00085     def properties(self,prop):
00086         """Set some properties of the graph.
00087         
00088         The set of properties is not yet determined.
00089         """
00090         # The particulars of how they are stored and manipulated (e.g., do 
00091         # we want an inventory internally) is not settled.  I've used a
00092         # property dictionary for now.
00093         #
00094         # How these properties interact with a user defined style file is
00095         # even less clear.
00096 
00097         # Properties defined by plot
00098         self.axesaxes.set_xlabel(prop["xlabel"])
00099         self.axesaxes.set_ylabel(prop["ylabel"])
00100         self.axesaxes.set_title(prop["title"])
00101 
00102         # Properties defined by user
00103         self.axesaxes.grid(True)
00104 
00105     def clear(self):
00106         """Reset the plot"""
00107         
00108         # TODO: Redraw is brutal.  Render to a backing store and swap in
00109         # TODO: rather than redrawing on the fly.
00110         self.axesaxes.clear()
00111         self.axesaxes.hold(True)
00112 
00113     def render(self):
00114         """Commit the plot after all objects are drawn"""
00115         # TODO: this is when the backing store should be swapped in.
00116         self.axesaxes.legend()
00117         pass
00118 
00119     def xaxis(self,label,units):
00120         """xaxis label and units.
00121         
00122         Axis labels know about units.
00123         
00124         We need to do this so that we can detect when axes are not
00125         commesurate.  Currently this is ignored other than for formatting
00126         purposes.
00127         """
00128         if units != "": label = label + " (" + units + ")"
00129         self.axesaxes.set_xlabel(label)
00130         pass
00131     
00132     def yaxis(self,label,units):
00133         """yaxis label and units."""
00134         if units != "": label = label + " (" + units + ")"
00135         self.axesaxes.set_ylabel(label)
00136         pass
00137 
00138     def _connect_to_xlim(self,callback):
00139         """Bind the xlim change notification to the callback"""
00140         def process_xlim(axes):
00141             lo,hi = axes.get_xlim()
00142             callback(lo,hi)
00143         self.axesaxes.callbacks.connect('xlim_changed',process_xlim)
00144     
00145     def connect(self,trigger,callback):
00146         if trigger == 'xlim': self._connect_to_xlim_connect_to_xlim(callback)
00147 
00148     def points(self,x,y,dx=None,dy=None,color=0,symbol=0,label=None):
00149         """Draw markers with error bars"""
00150         # Convert tuple (lo,hi) to array [(x-lo),(hi-x)]
00151         if dx != None and type(dx) == type(()):
00152             dx = nx.vstack((x-dx[0],dx[1]-x)).transpose()
00153         if dy != None and type(dy) == type(()):
00154             dy = nx.vstack((y-dy[0],dy[1]-y)).transpose()
00155 
00156         if True or dx is None and dy is None:
00157             self.lineslines = self.axesaxes.plot(x,y,color=self._color_color(color),
00158                                    marker=self._symbol_symbol(symbol))
00159         else:
00160             self.lineslines, hcap, hbar = self.axesaxes.errorbar(x,y,dy,color=self._color_color(color),
00161                                              marker=self._symbol_symbol(symbol), 
00162                                              linestyle='None',
00163                                              label=label,picker=5)
00164 
00165     def curve(self,x,y,dy=None,color=0,symbol=0,label=None):
00166         """Draw a line on a graph, possibly with confidence intervals."""
00167         c = self._color_color(color)
00168         hlist = self.axesaxes.plot(x,y,color=c,marker='',linestyle='-',label=label)
00169         if False and dy != None:
00170             if type(dy) == type(()):
00171                 self.axesaxes.plot(x,dy[0],color=c,
00172                                marker='',linestyle='--',label='_nolegend_')
00173                 self.axesaxes.plot(x,dy[1],color=c,
00174                                marker='',linestyle='--',label='_nolegend_')
00175             else:
00176                 self.axesaxes.plot(x,y+dy,color=c,
00177                                marker='',linestyle='--',label='_nolegend_')
00178                 self.axesaxes.plot(x,y-dy,color=c,
00179                                marker='',linestyle='--',label='_nolegend_')
00180 
00181     def _color(self,c):
00182         """Return a particular colour"""
00183         return self.colorlistcolorlist[c%len(self.colorlistcolorlist)]
00184 
00185     def _symbol(self,s):
00186         """Return a particular symbol"""
00187         return self.symbollistsymbollist[s%len(self.symbollistsymbollist)]
